issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing to the left, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy šhpwhly MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ēran kē čihr az yazdān| "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image| brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, connected across the shaft; four altar plates; above altar flames depicted by vertical lines; to the left of flames symbol (SNS 3, var.25), to the right symbol (SNS 3, var. 33); to the left and the right of the altar attendant with stylized mural crown, holding a barsom in both hands, left attendant with korymbos,  right  without korymbos, both facing inwards; left with korymbos, right without; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 1 h l. i. NWRA ZY, 11 h l. o. Šhpwhly| ādur ī Šābuhr| “the fire of Shapur”
